page.description: Fires if there was an error loading the Application Cache. If an error occurs, the UX Component will not be rendered.
page.discussion: An error will occur if any of the cache files do not exist. You can use this event to display an alert telling the user that there is a problem and the app will not load. The example below displays an error in a div defined in a Static Text control with the id *[js:APPCACHE_DOWNLOAD_ERROR]*.
page.note: To use this example in your own UX Component, you must add a div with the ID *[js:APPCACHE_DOWNLOAD_ERROR]* to the component. This can be done using the Static Text control. The Static Text control can be found in the *[ui:Other Controls]* section.
